intro: Hieracium rydbergii, commonly known as Rydberg's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Rydberg's hawkweed is often found in the western United States and is part of the diverse genus Hieracium.
